thread.title: Finalists for Midcoast Sports Hall of Fame athletes of year announced
thread.title_full: Finalists for Midcoast Sports Hall of Fame athletes of year announced

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Finalists for Midcoast Sports Hall of Fame athletes of year announced
text:
Finalists for Midcoast Sports Hall of Fame athletes of year announced Oceanside, Medomak Valley, Lincoln Academy, Camden Hills represented By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 View More... 
Waldoboro — The Midcoast Sports Hall of Fame has announced the fives male and five female finalists for the organization's 2014-15 high school athletes of the year. 
The two winners will be announced at the MSHOF's annual banquet on Saturday, Oct. 24 at the Rockland Elks Club. 
The finalists were selected by the organization's board of directors after considering a number of student-athletes for the honors. 
The male finalists include Medomak Valley's Nicholas DePatsy and Micah Williamson, Oceanside's Nick Mazurek and Zac Roman and Camden Hills' Mark McCluskey. 
The female finalists include Lincoln Academy's Miranda Achorn, Oceanside's Emily Gould and Jackie Thorbjornson, Medomak Valley's Hannah Marks and Camden Hills' Rachel Pease. 
Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston, Camden Hills of Rockport, Medomak Valley of Waldoboro, Lincoln Academy of Newcastle, Vinalhaven, North Haven and Islesboro high schools were asked to nominate two male and two female students as athlete-of-the-year candidates. 
The candidates then needed to complete a questionnaire and return it to the board to be considered. Any candidate who did not return the questionnaire was not considered for the award. 
The following are the five male finalists: 
DePatsy, a senior at Medomak Valley High School, has earned varsity letters in soccer, baseball and basketball. He was an important part of the Panthers’ success in basketball in 2013 and 2015 when the team won the Kennebec Valley Athletic Conference Class B championship, Eastern Class B championship and finished as state Class B runners-up both years. 
Mazurek, a senior at Oceanside High School, has been a member of the Mariner varsity golf, basketball and baseball teams. As a junior, in 2014, he was state Class A golf champion and was named male athlete of the year in 2014 by the Midcoast Sports Hall of Fame and by Courier Publications/VillageSoup. 
McCluskey, a 2015 graduate of Camden Hills Regional High School, was a member of the Windjammer cross-country, swimming and track-and-field teams. In swimming, he was the KVAC and state Class B champion in 50 freestyle, 200 freestyle and the 400 freestyle relay. McCluskey attends Howard University in Washington, D.C. where he is on the Division 1 swim team and will major in media, journalism and film. 
Roman, a 2015 graduate of Oceanside High School, was a member of the soccer and baseball teams and was first-team all-conference in both sports. He has set an Oceanside school career record for most stolen bases (62). Roman attends Maine Maritime Academy in Castine with a major in power engineering technology and is focusing primarily on his academics. 
Williamson, a 2015 graduate of Medomak Valley High School, was an outstanding three-sport athlete in soccer, basketball and baseball. He was team captain and team most valuable player on the baseball team and on the Panthers’ 2013 and 2015 basketball teams that were KVAC and Eastern Class B champions and state Class B runners-up. He attends the University of Southern Maine, enrolled in the exercise science program, and will try out for the USM basketball team. 
The following are the five female finalists: 
Gould, a 2015 graduate of Oceanside High School, was a varsity soccer and basketball player four years, and was voted the team's most valuable player for soccer and basketball. As a senior, she was chosen KVAC first-team all-conference and all-academic for soccer and basketball. Gould attends Bentley University in Waltham, Mass. where she majors in finance/accounting and will be involved with intramural basketball. 
Pease, a 2015 graduate of Camden Hills Regional High School, excelled in soccer, basketball and track and field. She played varsity goalie on the soccer team three years and was on the Windjammer KVAC Class B championship team her sophomore year. Pease made the varsity basketball team as a freshman, KVAC all-rookie team, the KVAC all-defensive team and KVAC first-team all-conference and all-academic. In August of 2015, she was selected as the Maine Wild Blueberry Queen at the Maine Wild Blueberry Festival at the Union Fair, and will carry out her duties as she attends college at Kennebec Valley Community College of Fairfield and Liberty University of Lynchburg, Va. to become an athletic trainer. 
Marks, a 2015 honor graduate of Medomak Valley High School, excelled in basketball and softball, as she played varsity in both sports as a freshman. In basketball, Marks was KVAC first-team all-conference twice and KVAC player of the year her senior year. As a senior, she was a McDonald’s all star, 3-point shooting champion, regional foul-shooting champion and state foul-shooting finalist, finishing third. 
Achorn, a 2015 graduate of Lincoln Academy, excelled in soccer, wrestling and softball. She was the Eagles' varsity soccer goalie four years and was KVAC second-team all-conference in 2013. Achorn was a member of the wrestling team four years, placing fourth in the states in 2013 and first in the girls state championship meet in 2015. She was the varsity softball catcher four years, receiving the coach’s award in 2014 and was KVAC second-team all-conference in 2014. In 2015, she was the softball team captain and was named to the senior all-star team and played all stars for the West/East versus New Hampshire. This summer and fall, Achorn played on championship coed softball teams in China and Augusta. 
Thorbjornson, 2015 valedictorian of Oceanside High School, participated in field hockey and indoor/outdoor track. She played varsity field hockey four years and was named to the KVAC all-rookie team in 2011, second-team all-conference in 2012, first-team all-conference in 2013 and 2014, was nominated for the KVAC player of the year in 2013, named All-State in 2013 and 2014 and was a New England Region All-American in 2014. In August, she was crowned the Maine Sea Goddess at the Maine Lobster Festival in Rockland. Thorbjornson will have a busy year as she fulfills her duties as Sea Goddess and attends Princeton University in New Jersey, majoring in biology. Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
